full_summary:
Title: Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) Solicitation

Publication Date: September 21, 2023

Solicitation Number: 24-241553

#### Brief Overview

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade, and Development (DFATD) is seeking professional services for a Web-based collaboration tool on the Microsoft 365 (M365) platform and Microsoft Azure Cloud platform. The services are required to support the transition from a traditional computing environment to modern information technology (IT) solutions for the delivery of corporate enterprise services to DFATD employees.

#### Requirements

The requirement is open to qualified TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders who possess expertise in Stream 1. A.6 Programmer/Software Developer and Stream 3. I.7 Platform Analyst, with a level of expertise 3. Up to 2 resources are required for each category.

The following unmodified trade agreements apply to this solicitation:

* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)

#### Description of Work

The DFATD requires the services of up to four (4) IT resources to design, deploy, support, and sustain the e-collaboration tool and Microsoft Azure Cloud platform. The resources will need to have expertise in Microsoft SharePoint Online (MS SPO) and Microsoft Teams (Teams) to build, deploy, and manage Azure applications and services.

#### Security Requirements

The common PS SRCL #19 applies, and the minimum corporate security required is Secret, with a minimum resource security required also being Secret.

#### Awarding Authority

The awarding authority for this solicitation is Deeptee Seebun. Inquiries regarding the requirement must be submitted to the Contracting Authority.

**Revision 2 of the solicitation has been made, which extends the closing date to October 20, 2023.**

*Note: This text has been subject to minor formatting to fit the 400-word limit*  Markdown formatting and proper grammar was applied to the response
